intro: Hieracium lepteriodes, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. Its leaves are narrow and linear, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a flat-topped inflorescence. Hieracium lepteriodes is known for its resilience to harsh climates and is often found in open, sunny habitats.
